name: ScreenFooter
description: A flexible footer component that stays at the bottom of the screen with support for various layouts, backgrounds, and keyboard behaviors

props.name: backgroundType
props.description: The background style of the footer [fading, solid, transparent]

props.name: layout
props.description: The layout direction of footer items [horizontal, vertical]

props.name: alignment
props.description: Cross-axis alignment [start, center, end]. In vertical layout: controls horizontal position. In horizontal layout: controls vertical position

props.name: horizontalAlignment
props.description: Main-axis alignment for horizontal layout only when distribution is STACK [start, center, end]

props.name: horizontalItemsDistribution
props.description: Distribution of items in horizontal layout [stack, spread]

props.name: itemsFit
props.description: How items should fit in vertical layout [fit, fixed, stretch]

props.name: keyboardBehavior
props.description: The footer's keyboard behavior [sticky, hoisted]. Sticky: stays at bottom when keyboard opens. Hoisted: pushed up when keyboard opens

props.name: itemWidth
props.description: Fixed width for all items (used with ItemsFit.FIXED)

props.name: visible
props.description: If true, the footer is visible. If false, it slides down

props.name: animationDuration
props.description: Duration of the show/hide animation in ms

props.name: useSafeArea
props.description: If true, the footer will respect the safe area (add bottom padding)

props.name: shadow
props.description: Shadow preset for solid background [sh10, sh20, sh30]. Only applies when backgroundType is 'solid'

props.name: hideDivider
props.description: If true, hides the top divider for solid background. Only applies when backgroundType is 'solid'

hero.title: ScreenFooter
hero.description: The ScreenFooter component provides a flexible footer that stays at the bottom of the screen with support for various layouts, backgrounds, and keyboard behaviors. It's ideal for forms, checkout flows, and any screen requiring persistent bottom actions.

sections.title: Use Examples
sections.description: The ScreenFooter can be used in various scenarios depending on the content and action hierarchy. Each layout type serves different use cases and provides different visual emphasis.

items.title: Horizontal - Spread
items.description: Best for two equally important actions positioned at opposite ends. Common in navigation flows or when presenting contrasting choices.

items.title: Horizontal - Stacked Center
items.description: Ideal for primary and secondary actions of similar importance that should be grouped together in the center.

items.title: Horizontal - With Content
items.description: Perfect for checkout or summary screens where you need to display information alongside actions. The footer can accommodate text, prices, or other content elements.

sections.title: Horizontal Layouts
sections.description: markdown: Horizontal layouts are best when screen content is abundant and vertical space is limited. They keep actions compact while maintaining good reachability. Use the `layout` prop set to `ScreenFooterLayouts.HORIZONTAL`.

items.title: Vertical - Fit
items.description: Buttons are sized based on their content. Best for clear action hierarchy with a prominent primary button and a subtle secondary link button.

items.title: Vertical - Stretched
items.description: Full-width buttons provide maximum tap area and visual prominence. Recommended for forms and high-priority actions where accessibility is crucial.

sections.title: Vertical Layouts
sections.description: markdown: Vertical layouts provide better action prominence and are recommended when a single primary action needs emphasis, or when content can be obscured. Use `itemsFit` prop with `ItemsFit.STRETCH` for full-width buttons or `ItemsFit.FIT` for content-sized buttons.

items.title: Solid
items.description: Provides clear separation with a solid background and optional shadow. Best for content-heavy screens where the footer needs to stand out.

items.title: Fading
items.description: Creates a subtle gradient overlay that doesn't obscure content completely. Ideal for minimal designs or when content should remain partially visible.

items.title: Transparent
items.description: No background overlay. Use when the screen has minimal content or a solid background color, and separation isn't needed.

sections.title: Background Types
sections.description: markdown: Choose the background type based on your content density and visual hierarchy needs. Set using the `backgroundType` prop.

items.title: Sticky
items.description: The footer remains at the bottom of the screen even when the keyboard is open. Best for short forms or when the footer actions don't relate to keyboard input.

items.title: Hoisted
items.description: The footer moves up with the keyboard, staying above it. Recommended for forms where users need immediate access to submit actions while typing.

sections.title: Keyboard Behavior
sections.description: markdown: Control how the footer responds to the keyboard using the `keyboardBehavior` prop. Choose `KeyboardBehavior.STICKY` to keep it at the bottom, or `KeyboardBehavior.HOISTED` to move it above the keyboard.
